title.narrative: QUALITY & EQUITY OF FUNDAMENTAL SCHOOL

description.narrative: By the end of 2018, access, quality and equity of fundamental school is improved through classroom construction and equipment, dissemination of teaching and learning materials, integration of conflict sensitive concepts and CFS in the curriculum, with emphasis on vulnerable children., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2018 - Outcome 1 / Education: School and preschool-aged children (4-12 years) have access to quality education and achieve universal primary education, and adolescents in and out of school have strengthened skills in the area of HIV / AIDS prevention, reproductive health and peacebuilding by 2018.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2018, access, quality and equity of fundamental school is improved through classroom construction and equipment,dissemination of teaching and learning materials, integration of conflict sensitive concepts and CFS in the curriculum, withemphasis on vulnerable children.

description.narrative: A total of 1,500,000 children benefited from UNICEF&39;s continued support for provision of learning and teaching materials (including 1,200,000 school kits), increased access to quality education through construction of 136 classrooms and building capacity nationwide of basic education school directors, inspectors and Cycle 4 teachers for the new curriculum. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
